page.title: 06GLASGOW WILDLIFE WEEK
page.content: Glasgow Wildlife Week is an annual event organised by the Glasgow Urban Wildlife Group which aims to open Glaswegians' eyes to the wildlife which surrounds them in the city. Several events and activities are organised. Just one of these was "Glasgow a Home for Wildlife" in which several primary schools participated: Levern, Gowanbank, St. Robert's, St. Vincent's, Carnwadric, Sir John Maxwell, Shawlands. Each class received a talk about Glasgows' wildlife at the school, carried out a pollution survey of a local burn, studied the woodland wildlife in Pollok Country Park and attended a wildlife filmshow at Eastwood Theatre. Quote of the Week: "It's really minging here"when pupils found dead eels,sticklebacks,trout etc in the Brock Burn.
